thread.title: Sena men storm BCCI’s Mumbai office, stall India-Pak cricket talks
thread.title_full: Sena men storm BCCI’s Mumbai office, stall India-Pak cricket talks

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Sena men storm BCCI’s Mumbai office, stall India-Pak cricket talks
text:
Shiv Kumar
Tribune News Service
Mumbai, October 19
Continuing their aggressive campaign against engagement with Islamabad in any form, Shiv Sena workers today stormed the headquarters of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) at Wankhede Stadium and forced the suspension of scheduled talks with Pakistan Cricket Board chief Shaharyar Khan over resumption of bilateral cricketing ties. Sena workers stormed BCCI chief Shashank Manohar’s office carrying placards with slogans like ‘Shahryar Khan Go Back’ and ‘Shashank Manohar Murdabad’. Waving black and saffron flags, they confronted Manohar and demanded that the BCCI snapped all ties with the PCB. After the protest, the talks on the proposed bilateral series have been rescheduled for tomorrow in New Delhi. The BCCI chief, however, was safely escorted out of the building by policemen. The attack sparked condemnation with Sena’s ally BJP saying there is no place for “hooliganism” while the Congress called it "abominable”. The police arrested 17 Shiv Sena workers on charges of unlawful assembly and violating Police Commissioner's order to refrain from such gathering, a senior police officer said. They, however, were later granted bail by a local court on a personal bond of Rs 2,000. The Shiv Sena justified the storming of the BCCI office. “I am proud of what the Shiv Sainiks did. This was what Balasaheb would have wanted. They (Pakistanis) are killing our jawans. And these people want to talk cricket with the Pakistanis,” said Shiv Sena leader Arvind Sawant said. Sanjay Raut, Shiv Sena MP and editor of party mouthpiece Saamna, also came out in support of party workers. “If we have taken law into our hands it is for a good cause. We are reflecting the mood of the nation,” Raut said. (With agency inputs)
